title: Michael Brantley makes stunning catch to start double play late in ALCS Game 6
text:
Astros left fielder Michael Brantley's diving catch in the seventh inning may have been the most important defensive play in all of baseball this season.

With a runner on first, one out and the Astros leading 4-2, Aaron Hicks hit a blooper into left field that Brantley managed to lay out and catch, and then threw behind Aaron Judge to double him off first base and end the inning.

According to Inside Edge, Brantley was rated as the best left fielder (min. 110 opportunities) during the 2019 regular season.

It's Brantley's first season with the Astros after spending the first 10 years of his career with the Indians. The 32-year-old has been an All-Star each of the past three seasons, starting this year's game in Cleveland.
description: Left fielder Michael Brantley made a diving grab on a ball hit by Aaron Hicks in the seventh inning of ALCS Game 6.
